body:
kezhuw:

As a remainder, `ReconfigBuilderImpl` is also suspicious but have not verified yet.

tison:

For the calls to sendBackgroundResponse, IIRC the path and name are returned from callback, so it's not handled by CuratorFramework namespace?

If you suspect the behavior, I suggest you write a test that fails with current implementation so that we can understand the case clearly.

tison:

Oops, I confuse CreateBuilderImpl and CuratorEventImpl. I agree that the ctor looks weird now:

this.path = client.unfixForNamespace(path);
this.name = name;

kezhuw:

Another strip resides in makeCuratorEvent, before CURATOR-665 it resides in sendBackgroundResponse. It has no relationship with CURATOR-665.

path = client.unfixForNamespace(path);
name = client.unfixForNamespace(name);

PS: There is no createResponseEvent. I turns out that I checked out dated revision of CURATOR-665. Nothing changed.

@Ryan0751 Any interest  to continue this ? I think you can construct a test with `ModeledCacheListener.handleException`. `TestCachedModeledFramework` should be the right place. I can take care of it in case you are not available. We are evaluating this and plan to conclude (merge or not) this before next release.
I will take another look!

This looks reasonable but I recall this is a very difficult are to play around with. The tests pass, so that's good. It would be nice to find a few users who can validate this against real world usages.

Another change is we now trim `name` when constructing `CuratorEventImpl`, while I review all the references to `getName` from an async Create callback, and the `name` is previously trimmed in the `sendBackground...` method. Other async callbacks may behavior differently but it seems few users will use `name` there.

This patch implements what we should originally do IMO. Due to the error state is rare so we don't receive reports before.
I have gone ahead and added a unit test for this.

@tisonkun  Only `create` has `name`. In zookeeper [async callbacks](https://github.com/apache/zookeeper/blob/3eda8a3a00ef3230d6c16f6ddf9201a3c0f5ca07/zookeeper-server/src/main/java/org/apache/zookeeper/AsyncCallback.java#L209), only `Create2Callback` and `StringCallback`, which both are callback for `ZooKeeper::create`, have `name` parameter. And `unfixForNamespace` is tolerated to `null` input, so I moved it to where we trim `path`. This enable caller to treat them same.

@Randgalt No sure whether it is related, there is [CURATOR-379](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CURATOR-379)(#194), but its test does not convince me either. Though, it is possible for namespace "/zoo" and `getConfig`'s path "/zookeeper/config", but it is another story [ZOOKEEPER-4601](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZOOKEEPER-4601), [CURATOR-667](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CURATOR-667).

Now I understand that this is intended to be provided and we don't shade this dependency. It's possible for upgrade jackson version to 2.14.0 after you open a JIRA ticket and resubmit a patch associated with the ticket.
Thanks for your contribution @Ryan0751! It reminds me of one of my PRs merged after two years in `apache/flink` 🤣

Thanks for your contribution @davidcopley!

Merging...

Merging...

Thank you @Ryan0751!
After another look, I actually think that we should fail on `create("/zoo/foo/bar/")` with "malformed path" instead of auto strip at first XD. But it's public user-facing behavior now.
Merging...

Closing...

In favor of https://github.com/apache/curator/pull/459. We can integrate INFRA provided https://ge.apache.org/ to have a one-stop test reports viewer.

tison:

Thanks for your reply Dóra HorváthAndor Molnar!

Recently, I noticed that Curator tests are sometimes flaky and consume a lot of time. Thus I filed CURATOR-669 to integrate with NFRA provided https://ge.apache.org/ to have a one-stop test reports viewer.

As you said above, such a script can be useful for downstream projects, and the patch is here. So they can find it and use it if necessary.

> .. a similar script got integrated into ZooKeeper and multiple other projects as well and they are all used in our organisation. We believe it can be useful for others as well.

Different projects make different choices. Since this script is unlikely to introduce conflict, you can add it to your organization's fork.

tison:

I ever brought best practices somewhere else if that project needed it, and was also rejected when they didn't think a build change was good for their project.

  • https://github.com/cockroachdb/cockroach/pull/78694
  • https://github.com/tikv/tikv/pull/11080
  • https://github.com/apache/pulsar-client-node/pull/314
  • https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/RATIS-1795

So maybe another sponsor who is an active contributor is a good reason to accept such changes. Said I never use merge-pr.py, but the original contributor uses it, so it’s OK to keep it there.

kezhuw:

kezhuw:

It has been a decade since fa3ac29a35eb0c2db0f04541fe20a867f45070d3 or even earlier. It is part of Curator API.

kezhuw:

@clayburn Updated at a298df5c9296421766c74e7d4ac557aa710a0620. Please give another look :D
OK. I'm trying to redact mvn command.
After a closer look, I'm going to remove the if block for now.

This test is failing on the Java 8 test build: https://ge.apache.org/s/ovviiad2aixry/tests/overview?outcome=failed

I don't know much about your test suite, but I would assume this one is not related to the changes in this PR?
@clayburn Yep. I have rerun the tests and such flaky tests are part of issue we want to located and resolve with the help of Gradle Enterprise integration.
Reported to https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CURATOR-671. I saw this also in #460(parallel with this pr). cc @clayburn @tisonkun
Pending to merge...

tison:

master via 1e82d0c1d0708d84d06e5757e435d1d9dbebfb48

kezhuw:

After go through CURATOR-280, I think we should not implement such a feature. My concerns are here:

  • Consistent with ZooKeeper.
  • I somewhat consider "chroot" may come from a different team. That team should prepare "chroot" and its auths.
  • It is easy to circumvent using client.create.forPath("/"). In above concept, client itself become "that team".

Given above points, and the fact that this issue have been existed for so long without a update from other committers, I am going to closed it as "won't fix".

kezhuw:

We already have ci for Java 11 and Java 17. I think it is sufficient for us to close this.

kezhuw:

NodeExistException is expected if target node exists. You can resort to CreateBuilder.orSetData if you don't want such an exception.

kezhuw:

It was first implemented at 26364c6186fc7c09a9462557b1ca791e9aa70006. And then fixed by CURATOR-551.

kezhuw:

It has been fixed by ZOOKEEPER-1576 which shipped in 3.5.0 and Curator 2.9.1 uses 3.4.6. Before that, StaticHostProvider thrown UnknownHostException in construction.

kezhuw:

Some tests are flaky. And TestTreeCache.testIsolatedThreadGroup has been deleted in 75d3c196cd40745ac8c3cd9040f4043168b704f5. We have released 5.5.0.

kezhuw:

CuratorFramework is "Zookeeper framework-style client". So create and setData have same behavior as ZooKeeper regarding "the behavior if nodes already exist". Though, CuratorFramework has rich API such as CreateBuilder.orSetData to fallback to setData in case of "the ZNode already exists". Given that, this jira has been opened so long with no following progress, I am going to closed it as "won't fix".

kezhuw:

After a look for the pr apache/curator#13, I think it is fixed.

kezhuw:

These two classes has been deleted in upgrading to 5.0.0. See CURATOR-558.

kezhuw:

This class has been deleted in upgrading to 5.0.0. See Curator-558.

kezhuw:

Curator uses Guaranteeable.guaranteed in deleting lock path. In case of exception, it will try the deletion in background. So the result is that:

  • If session expired, the lock path will be deleted by zk.
  • If session not expired, curator will delete it finally in background.
    Basically, InterProcessMutex.release don't supposed to be retried. I rarely saw retry-able lock release in case of error.

kezhuw:

Most framework uses single thread to execute callbacks to maintain ordered delivery. Curator and ZooKeeper have no exception.

kezhuw:

It is by design unless CuratorFramework.close is called. You can custom RetryPolicy to stop retry on SESSIONEXPIRED.

kezhuw:

Curator has no "command", ZooKeeper does have. See ZOOKEEPER-1908.

kezhuw:

I think this was deliberately designed as this so ServiceInstance.builder is the sole creator of ServiceInstanceBuilder. All fields in ServiceInstanceBuilder are mappings to fields in ServiceInstance, so I don't think there is much value to make ServiceInstanceBuilder more open.

kezhuw:

And we are 5.5.0 now.

kezhuw:

We have github actions now.

kezhuw:

ZooKeeper has LsCommand, Curator does not have this. See ZOOKEEPER-1962.

kezhuw:

Curator is a framework around ZooKeeper. It uses persistent recursive watch to build things that ZooKeeper do not support. If you want access to ZooKeeper side, try CuratorFramework::getZookeeperClient and CuratorZookeeperClient::getZooKeeper to access ZooKeeper directly.

kezhuw:

The failure point.

Error:  Failures: 
Error:  org.apache.curator.framework.recipes.leader.TestLeaderSelectorCluster.testLostRestart
Error:    Run 1: TestLeaderSelectorCluster.testLostRestart:181 expected:  but was: 
Error:    Run 2: TestLeaderSelectorCluster.testLostRestart:181 expected:  but was: 
Error:    Run 3: TestLeaderSelectorCluster.testLostRestart:181 expected:  but was:
Thank you for your reviewing. @tisonkun

We hit this issue in prod, and it seems that the chance to hit this issue is not small when system load is high. 
Do we have any plan to backport the fix? Because curator 5.x is not compatible with zk 3.4.x which is used in our prod.

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CURATOR-561
I think that this fixed code may ultimately  correct the state of Curator.

kezhuw:

master: 4221604facf2447f4ef7789842ac0b8c4a9d4763
I missed code paths in `handleBackgroundOperationException(operationAndData, e)` from `performBackgroundOperation` could introduce. Let me check.
Updated. PTAL @kezhuw @cammckenzie @eolivelli

I replayed this.
1. git fetch origin
2. gh pr checkout -f 463
3. git reset --hard d8c8bc38c682fa674617907f8fe3112947e8bdf0
4. git rebase origin/master
5. ./mvnw spotless:apply
6. git diff 236d49fc888c6897164419115b69a4bf4f57688d

The final step gives no output and `echo $?` outputs `0`. So I am confident about the remains.

Look forward for this.
As we agree on the mailing list already, I'll merge this patch in hours.
Merging...

tison:

master via 484ede9a33abb1427ba58c77e5792814aac889f0

> I missed code paths in handleBackgroundOperationException(operationAndData, e) from performBackgroundOperation could introduce. Let me check.

I have pushed one more commit to solve this. There are still chances for `BackgroundCallback` no called, and I have created [CURATOR-677][] for what I have found. I plan to solve it separately so we can keep this pr simple.

[CURATOR-677]: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CURATOR-677

@eolivelli @tisonkun Could you please take another look ?

The code changed a bit due to last commit c18cb6fb6de30aeae4f8d04dcfff3d6e04d49112. It adds `abortOperation` to handle exception from background operation and `BackgroundOperation::getBackgroundEventType` for `abortOperation` to delivery event with correct event type.

kezhuw:

LockInternals::deleteOurPath uses Guaranteeable::guaranteed to delete lock path. If the session is repaired before expired, it was supposed to delete that path in background.

Did you configure the retry policy ? CONNECTIONLOSS has to be retriable for this to function.

PS: I replied similar in CURATOR-486.

JIRAUSER291535:

Kezhu Wang Yes. we have configured retry policy. but we don't retry forever, we set a limit for number of retries. the exception was thrown after all retries failed.

kezhuw:

but we don't retry forever, we set a limit for number of retries

That is ok. guaranteed is supposed to ignore retry limit.

As a result, even when the zk connection recovered later, ALL following acquire() failed due to the inconsistency (not present in local `threadData` but the OLD zk node were still present).

Any possibility for an reproducible test case ?

a suggestion is to remove the local data ONLY after znode deletion is a success.

A client "failure" could be a success in server side. This will introduce double-leader.
@eolivelli @tisonkun Thank you for reviewing! Merged.

kezhuw:

Future tasks are left as "relates to" jiras.

kezhuw:

The exception stack is same as CURATOR-436. I think it has been fixed by that jira.

kezhuw:

I copied the test to local and sleeping with 2 * sessionTimout results in no failures.

Closing...

Don't know what this patch wants to do.
Merging...
